channel.title: CVE Feed for Dell -- CPG BIOS
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Dell -- CPG BIOS

item.title: CVE-2021-36325|2024-08-04T00:54:51.468Z -- dell -- cpg%20bios
item.description: Dell BIOS contains an improper input validation vulnerability. A local authenticated malicious user may potentially exploit this vulnerability by using an SMI to gain arbitrary code execution in SMRAM.

item.title: CVE-2020-5379|2024-08-04T08:30:23.807Z -- dell -- cpg%20bios
item.description: Dell Inspiron 7352 BIOS versions prior to A12 contain a UEFI BIOS Boot Services overwrite vulnerability. A local attacker with access to system memory may exploit this vulnerability by overwriting the EFI_BOOT_SERVICES structure to execute arbitrary code in System Management Mode (SMM).

item.title: CVE-2021-36342|2024-08-04T00:54:51.436Z -- dell -- cpg%20bios
item.description: Dell BIOS contains an improper input validation vulnerability. A local authenticated malicious user may potentially exploit this vulnerability by using an SMI to gain arbitrary code execution in SMRAM.

item.title: CVE-2020-5378|2024-08-04T08:30:24.241Z -- dell -- cpg%20bios
item.description: Dell G7 17 7790 BIOS versions prior to 1.13.2 contain a UEFI BIOS Boot Services overwrite vulnerability. A local attacker with access to system memory may exploit this vulnerability by overwriting the EFI_BOOT_SERVICES structure to execute arbitrary code in System Management Mode (SMM).

item.title: CVE-2020-26186|2024-08-04T15:49:07.191Z -- dell -- cpg%20bios
item.description: Dell Inspiron 5675 BIOS versions prior to 1.4.1 contain a UEFI BIOS RuntimeServices overwrite vulnerability. A local attacker with access to system memory may exploit this vulnerability by overwriting the RuntimeServices structure to execute arbitrary code in System Management Mode (SMM).

item.title: CVE-2021-36283|2024-08-04T00:54:50.707Z -- dell -- cpg%20bios
item.description: Dell BIOS contains an improper input validation vulnerability. A local authenticated malicious user may potentially exploit this vulnerability by using an SMI to gain arbitrary code execution in SMRAM.

item.title: CVE-2020-5388|2024-08-04T08:30:23.928Z -- dell -- cpg%20bios
item.description: Dell Inspiron 15 7579 2-in-1 BIOS versions prior to 1.31.0 contain an Improper SMM communication buffer verification vulnerability. A local authenticated malicious user may potentially exploit this vulnerability by using an SMI to gain arbitrary code execution in SMRAM.

item.title: CVE-2021-36324|2024-08-04T00:54:51.438Z -- dell -- cpg%20bios
item.description: Dell BIOS contains an improper input validation vulnerability. A local authenticated malicious user may potentially exploit this vulnerability by using an SMI to gain arbitrary code execution in SMRAM.

item.title: CVE-2021-36323|2024-08-04T00:54:51.416Z -- dell -- cpg%20bios
item.description: Dell BIOS contains an improper input validation vulnerability. A local authenticated malicious user may potentially exploit this vulnerability by using an SMI to gain arbitrary code execution in SMRAM.

item.title: CVE-2020-5357|2024-08-04T08:30:23.393Z -- dell -- cpg%20bios
item.description: Dell Dock Firmware Update Utilities for Dell Client Consumer and Commercial docking stations contain an Arbitrary File Overwrite vulnerability. The vulnerability is limited to the Dell Dock Firmware Update Utilities during the time window while being executed by an administrator. During this time window, a locally authenticated low-privileged malicious user could exploit this vulnerability by tricking an administrator into overwriting arbitrary files via a symlink attack. The vulnerability does not affect the actual binary payload that the update utility delivers.

item.title: CVE-2021-36343|2024-08-04T00:54:51.454Z -- dell -- cpg%20bios
item.description: Dell BIOS contains an improper input validation vulnerability. A local authenticated malicious user may potentially exploit this vulnerability by using an SMI to gain arbitrary code execution in SMRAM.

item.title: CVE-2020-5376|2024-08-04T08:30:24.177Z -- dell -- cpg%20bios
item.description: Dell Inspiron 7347 BIOS versions prior to A13 contain a UEFI BIOS Boot Services overwrite vulnerability. A local attacker with access to system memory may exploit this vulnerability by overwriting the EFI_BOOT_SERVICES structure to execute arbitrary code in System Management Mode (SMM).

item.title: CVE-2020-5361|2024-08-04T08:30:24.015Z -- dell -- cpg%20bios
item.description: Select Dell Client Commercial and Consumer platforms support a BIOS password reset capability that is designed to assist authorized customers who forget their passwords. Dell is aware of unauthorized password generation tools that can generate BIOS recovery passwords. The tools, which are not authorized by Dell, can be used by a physically present attacker to reset BIOS passwords and BIOS-managed Hard Disk Drive (HDD) passwords. An unauthenticated attacker with physical access to the system could potentially exploit this vulnerability to bypass security restrictions for BIOS Setup configuration, HDD access and BIOS pre-boot authentication.

item.title: CVE-2020-5387|2024-08-04T08:30:23.973Z -- dell -- cpg%20bios
item.description: Dell XPS 13 9370 BIOS versions prior to 1.13.1 contains an Improper Exception Handling vulnerability. A local attacker with physical access could exploit this vulnerability to prevent the system from booting until the exploited boot device is removed.

item.title: CVE-2021-36285|2024-08-04T00:54:51.426Z -- dell -- cpg%20bios
item.description: Dell BIOS contains an Improper Restriction of Excessive Authentication Attempts vulnerability. A local authenticated malicious administrator could exploit this vulnerability to bypass excessive NVMe password attempt mitigations in order to carry out a brute force attack.

item.title: CVE-2021-36284|2024-08-04T00:54:50.814Z -- dell -- cpg%20bios
item.description: Dell BIOS contains an Improper Restriction of Excessive Authentication Attempts vulnerability. A local authenticated malicious administrator could exploit this vulnerability to bypass excessive admin password attempt mitigations in order to carry out a brute force attack.

item.title: CVE-2020-5348|2024-08-04T08:30:23.351Z -- dell -- cpg%20bios
item.description: Dell Latitude 7202 Rugged Tablet BIOS versions prior to A28 contain a UAF vulnerability in EFI_BOOT_SERVICES in system management mode. A local unauthenticated attacker may exploit this vulnerability by overwriting the EFI_BOOT_SERVICES structure to execute arbitrary code in system management mode.

item.title: CVE-2024-32859|2024-08-02T02:20:35.656Z -- dell -- cpg%20bios
item.description: Dell Client Platform BIOS contains an Improper Input Validation vulnerability in an externally developed component. A high privileged attacker with local access could potentially exploit this vulnerability, leading to Code execution.

item.title: CVE-2024-32860|2024-08-02T02:20:35.674Z -- dell -- cpg%20bios
item.description: Dell Client Platform BIOS contains an Improper Input Validation vulnerability in an externally developed component. A high privileged attacker with local access could potentially exploit this vulnerability, leading to Code execution.

item.description: Dell Client Platform BIOS contains an Out-of-bounds Write vulnerability in an externally developed component. A high privileged attacker with local access could potentially exploit this vulnerability, leading to Information tampering.

item.description: Dell Client Platform contains an incorrect authorization vulnerability. An attacker with physical access to the system could potentially exploit this vulnerability by bypassing BIOS authorization to modify settings in the BIOS.

item.title: CVE-2023-48674|2024-06-04T17:27:37.432Z -- dell -- cpg%20bios
item.description: Dell Platform BIOS contains an Improper Null Termination vulnerability. A high privilege user with network access to the system could potentially send malicious data to the device in order to cause some services to cease to function.

item.description: Dell BIOS contains a missing support for integrity check vulnerability. An attacker with physical access to the system could potentially bypass security mechanisms to run arbitrary code on the system.
